resources.description: This can be used to see the feilds that are required by a specific content type. The example content typoe that is been used is the project content type.
resources.name: Content Type Requirements

body.text:
{ "@type": "project", "title":"Project by api 1", "description":"Project for tessting purposes", "attendees":[], "start":"2019-06-12T17:20:00+00:00", "end":"2020-06-17T19:00:00+00:00", "whole_day":true, "open_end":true, "sync_uid":null, "contact_name":"", "contact_email":"", "contact_phone":"", "event_url":null, "location":"Office Quito", "recurrence":null, "image":{ "filename":"test.jpg", "content-type": "image/jpeg", "data":"", "encoding": "base64" }, "image_caption":"Image captions", "text":{ "content-type": "text/html", "data": "

This event is just for test that starts at 12 today and goes on until I feel like it should stop

", "encoding": "utf-8" }, "changeNote":null }

resources.description: The post comand can be used to create a new Porject content type. It is required to put the project content type in the project folder. Along with the name you can set the specific features that you would need on creation.
resources.name: test post project

resources.description: Use this method to delete a user thats no longer needed.Take care in how you use this api call. On successful deletion it will not retunr any json. More information can be found at: https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/users.html#delete-user
resources.name: delete a user

resources.description: To update the user information of a specific user this method can be used. On successful change it will not return any json. More information can be found at: https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/users.html#update-user
resources.name: Update user

resources.description: This currently is not working and will be updated more information can be found at: https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/users.html#reset-user-password
resources.name: Reset password

resources.description: This currently is not working and will be updated more information can be found at: https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/users.html#reset-own-password
resources.name: Change password

resources.description:
To create a new user for the system this method can be used. Pay keen attention to the role of the user. On successful creation it will return a detailed json code about the user.
More information can be found at: https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/users.html#create-user
resources.name: create

resources.description:
To read the user information of a specific user you may use this. More inforamtion can be found at 
https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/users.html#read-user
resources.name: read user

resources.description: This can be used for debvugging purposes to list all the users on the system. More information can be found at : https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/users.html#list-users
resources.name: List users
get Token

resources.description:
This method is used to renew the token created for authentication
more information can be found at : https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/authentication.html#renewing-a-token-login-renew
resources.name: Renew Token

resources.description:
This method can be used to logout a user or invalidate a token.
Currently unavailable. It will automatically disable the token after a period of time not being used 
More information can be found at: https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/authentication.html#invalidating-a-token-logout
resources.name: Logout or invalidatig token

resources.description:
This method of authentication is more secured as it allows authetntication to be done using the token which was retrieved from authentication

More information can be found at: https://plonerestapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/authentication.html#authenticating-with-a-token
resources.name: Token Auth

resources.description: The post comand can be used to create a new Porject content type. It is required to put the project content type in the project folder. Along with the name you can set the specific features that you would need on creation.
resources.name: Project

resources.description:
This is used to fetch the project details of a specific project from the list. 
The example project have the id of 

http://localhost:8080/Quito/projects/concert

which is used. Each project have a name and the various details for the project. A project can also hold the content type cal Task List. This is the list of tasks in the project and the id of the tasks list can be used to get the tasks that are in the list.
resources.name: Project

resources.description:
This is used to delete a task list . All the contents within the list will be deleted with it.
On successful deletion it should not retunr any Json
resources.name: Task List

resources.description: This can be used to create a new tasks List . It is required to place the tasks list inside of a project
resources.name: Task List

resources.description:
This api comand can be used to get the list of tasks that are available in the tasks list. Each task have an id which could be used to view its detail . The tasks can be found in the items tag. 


	{
      "@id": "http://localhost:8080/Quito/projects/concert/need-to-do/get-volunteers",
      
      "@type": "task",
      
      "description": "",
      
      "review_state": "published",
      
      "title": "Get volunteers"
      
    }
resources.name: Task List

resources.description: This is used to delete a specific task
resources.name: Task

resources.description: This can be used to create a specific task. This task should be placed within a task list.
resources.name: Task

resources.description: The get Task comand can be used to get the details for a specific task
resources.name: Task
